review: So here are the streaming devices our family currently has:Roku 2100X XDSRoku 2 XS3rd gen Apple TVVarious streaming blu ray playersPS3Amazon Fire TVAmazon Fire TV StickThese are the services we use:iTunesAmazon Instant Video (Prime also)Netflix StreamingHulu PlusVarious Cable TV related appsIn the end the our favorites are the Apple TV and the Amazon Fire products including the Fire Stick.We originally liked the idea of Roku until we realized that over time, Roku does not allow updates to the apps on older models.This effectively forces you to but the newest model of the Roku to get updates to apps.  It's one thing for the Roku operating system but for the apps, this is unreasonable.  This does not seem to be the case with the other devices.  As least at this time.  They are also all cheaper than the higher end Roku devices.  But I'm digressing, if you primarily use the more mainstream apps like Netflix and Hulu as well as Amazon related media, than the Fire TV stick is a no brainer to me.  It's cheap and it's fast.  We liked the Fire TV enough (it originally replace one of our Roku's) that we got another one to replace our other Roku.  The Fire Stick and Fire both stream things much faster than our other devices...including our Apple TV but we have lots of Apple devices so that's why the Apple TV is in our top three.  In any case, I think that's the main reason to get the stick over other devices aside from the relatively cheap cost is the speed.  It was always annoying how long it takes to load videos.  And i think the only real difference between the Fire Stick and the Fire TV is the voice recognition remote.  We really don't use that function on the Fire TV so it wasn't a lost to use.
